posts.name: Rohan
posts.cooked:
Hi! I am from team 6147, and we are using PathPlanner for our Autonomous. However, at our regional competition, we ended up having to, at the beginning of each match, redeploy code with either true or false , depending on whether we were on the Red or Blue Alliance for the PathPlanner AutoBuilder configuration method call - see the screenshot:

image 1056×495 36.9 KB .

image 1056×495 36.9 KB

image 1056×495 36.9 KB

However, is there a way to directly access which alliance we are from the central connection hub that we reprogram our radio to at the competition? Something along the lines of FMS .getAlliance()? I would like to stay away from using the selected value in DriverStation and then running DriverStation.getAlliance(), or its equivalent through SmartDashboard.

Any help would be greatly appreciated!

Thanks, 6147

posts.name: Alex
posts.cooked: The Driver station class is getting it straight from the FMS based on the station u connect to. That’s exactly what you should be using.

posts.name: Hunter Rothman
posts.cooked:
In the Pathplanner docs you can look at how they configure their autobuilder. They pull directly from the fms.

There’s the link. https://pathplanner.dev/pplib-build-an-auto.html#configure-autobuilder

posts.name: Rohan
posts.cooked: Thank you all so much! I had no idea that the .getAlliance() method call was based directly on the station we’re connected to!

posts.name: Alex
posts.cooked: When it not connected to FMS u can set it urself in DS to test and practice. When it on the field it’s all done for you.

posts.name: Rohan
posts.cooked: This was one of the things I was unsure about; thank you so much for the info!

Researching this a bit more, it seems that you can ask the FMS but it is not guaranteed to have correct data until after the DriverStation is connected. Thus the creation of AutoBuilder needs to be moved out of the constructor of drivetrain and moved to after the DriverStation is connected. See this thread

https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/robot-does-not-reset-odometry-and-gyro-heading-for-pathplanner-paths-after-power-cycling/460424/15

link_counts.title: Robot Does Not Reset Odometry and Gyro Heading For PathPlanner Paths after Power Cycling

posts.name: Thad House
posts.cooked: That is why it was changed to an optional for 2024. There is no guarantee its available when the robot is booted up. Its not valid until it actually receives something from the DS . That is also why the driverStationConnection() function was added.

The issue is that the PP example code doesn’t  correctly show this implementation. It has the AutoBuilder being constructed during the constructor of the drivetrain class. If the example code is to be what teams use as their model (especially for teams who aren’t as knowledgeable), the example code needs to be changed to show the correct implementation.

posts.name: Thad House
posts.cooked: I did not know their example did that. It definitely should not. Something the PP people would need to change.

posts.name: system
posts.cooked: This topic was automatically closed 365 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.
